item.content:encoded:
Community

I always liked the concept that Communication + Unity = Community, but haven’t meditated on why.

In my experience, a neighborhood is healthy when its community of families is open and unified, and I see cities as larger, frankensteined patchwork structures of the more human-scaled neighborhoods. I think that a healthy city would require the same collective, open and transparent communication operating under a peaceful, unified effort.

I can see the nation-state as a next-order amalgam of these frankeneighborhood cities
and that if the same community principles of open communication and cooperative unity were applied at this level the nation might just survive and thrive.

item.content:encoded:
Social Media is Antisocial

Social Media is actually extremely antisocial if
you look at what’s happening with the mobs of arrogantly opinionated twits on Twitter. Functionally, social media apps are designed to allow users to troll and block each other. These are features, nut bugs.

Similarly, the hysterically anti-scientific 2M Social Distancing mandate is actually only effective at creating antisocial behaviours. I suspect this is not a bug either. An antisocial people are a weak and divided people.

Without unity and a common truth, we are as easily controlled as cattle guided to the abattoir.

item.content:encoded:
Blogs are dead.

I tried this new-fangled idea of “web-logging” my thoughts once back when WordPress was a new thing, but I found that, unless you’re one of the microscopic percentile of opinionated pundits or enlightened tech-gurus that has a following, it’s just a huge waste of time and effort for what ultimately amounts to a public diary which nobody will ever read.

So, yeah, here I am bloggin’ again just to make the point.
